content.text:
# List of American flag officers killed during the War of 1812

Over the course of the War of 1812, several high ranking American officers were killed. Note that until 1857, Captain was the highest rank in the United States Navy.
List
{| class="wikitable sortable sticky-header" style="text-align:left;"
! Name
! Rank
! Command
! Date
! class="unsortable" | Notes
|-
| James Lingan
| Brigadier General
|
| 28 July 1812
| Killed during the 1812 Baltimore riots
|-
| Zebulon Pike
| Brigadier General
| Landing force of the Army of the North
| 27 April 1813
| Killed by debris from firearm magazine explosion during the Battle of York
|-
| James Lawrence
| Captain
| USS Chesapeake
| 4 June 1813
|  Died of wounds received during the Battle of Boston Harbor
|-
| Leonard Covington
| Brigadier General
| Third Brigade
| 14 November 1813
| Died of wounds received during the Battle of Crysler's Farm.
|-
| John Swift
| Brigadier General
|
| 14 July 1814
| Died of wounds received during the Invasion of Fort George, Ontario
|-
| Benjamin Howard
| Brigadier General
| Eighth Military Department
| 18 September 1814
| Died of an illness in St. Louis after an expedition against Native American villages around Lake Pimiteoui
|}
References
